title: Understanding Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way of expressing very large or very small numbers conveniently. It involves writing a number as a product of a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ and a power of $$10$$.

title: Converting to Scientific Notation
text: To convert a decimal like $$0.0000000715$$ into scientific notation, you need to move the decimal point to the right until you have a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$. Count the number of moves; this will be the power of $$10$$.

title: Identify the Number Between $$1$$ and $$10$$
text: What is the number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ when you move the decimal point in $$0.0000000715$$ to make it so?

title: Counting the Decimal Points
text: In the number $$0.0000000715$$, you've moved the decimal point to the right how many times until you got $$7.15$$? Each move represents a division by $$10$$, so the power of $$10$$ will be negative.

title: Determine the Power of $$10$$
text: How many places did you move the decimal point to get from $$0.0000000715$$ to $$7.15$$?

title: Combine the Components
text: Put together the number $$7.15$$ and $$10$$ to the power of $$-8$$ to write the scientific notation for $$0.0000000715$$.
